description:
About the job
Mercier Consultancy BG is excited to offer a unique opportunity for aspiring Healthcare Assistants looking to launch their careers in Ireland. This role is perfect for individuals with no prior experience, as we provide comprehensive training and support. Additionally, we offer a paid relocation package to facilitate your move to Ireland. As a Healthcare Assistant, you will be integral in providing compassionate care and support to patients in various settings.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist patients with daily activities such as personal hygiene, dressing, and eating
Offer emotional support and companionship to promote patients' wellbeing
Maintain a clean and safe living environment in accordance with healthcare standards
Monitor patient conditions and report any changes to the nursing team
Engage patients in social and recreational activities to enhance their quality of life
Support the nursing staff with their daily tasks to ensure high-quality care
Participate in training sessions to develop your skills and understanding of patient care

Requirements

No prior experience is necessary; we are seeking motivated individuals eager to learn
Fluency in English is essential for effective communication with colleagues and patients
A caring and compassionate attitude is crucial for providing excellent patient care
Ability to work collaboratively in a team; independent work ethic is also important
Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills are required
Willingness to adhere to healthcare policies and procedures
Openness to relocating to Ireland and exploring a new cultural experience

Benefits

Competitive salary (‚Ç¨28,000-‚Ç¨30,000 depending on experience and location)
Paid training and ongoing career development
Full-time guaranteed contracts
Free uniform and parking
Flight fares paid
Cycle to work scheme
Employee assistance and wellbeing program
Supportive, friendly working environments and a warm Irish welcome 
Relocation assistance to help candidates settle comfortably in Ireland 
Help with identifying job opportunities for accompanying family members

title: Flight Attendant
detail:

description:
About the job
Your next adventure starts here ‚Äì join a world-leading airline and make every journey unforgettable.
At Imploy, we believe great people make great companies. As a trusted recruitment partner, we connect exceptional individuals with inspiring opportunities. Today, we‚Äôre hiring on behalf of a globally renowned international airline, and we‚Äôre looking for passionate, people-focused Flight Attendants ready to bring comfort, care, and confidence to travelers across the globe.
This is a full-time role, open to candidates across the EMEA region, with remote onboarding and training provided.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing
As a Flight Attendant, you're not just getting people from point A to point B ‚Äî you‚Äôre turning travel into a truly memorable experience. From helping a nervous first-time flyer feel at ease, to calmly handling mid-flight situations, you'll be the heart of the cabin.
Your day-to-day will include:
Keeping passengers safe by following all safety and emergency procedures.
Offering friendly, professional service to make everyone on board feel welcome and supported.
Leading safety demonstrations and assisting with boarding, in-flight service, and arrival.
Staying calm and taking charge in any situation ‚Äî from turbulence to medical events.
Keeping the cabin tidy and organized, and completing all necessary flight reports.
Being a true team player ‚Äî supporting your fellow crew and making the whole journey smooth.
What We‚Äôre Looking For
We‚Äôre not just looking for experience ‚Äî we‚Äôre looking for the right attitude. If you love meeting new people, have a calm and caring nature, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, you might be the perfect fit.
Here‚Äôs what helps you stand out:
Background in customer service, hospitality, or similar roles ‚Äî airline experience is a bonus.
Great communication skills and a natural way with people.
Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.
Professional, polished appearance and positive attitude.
Willingness to work shifts, weekends, and travel internationally.
Physically fit and able to meet international airline health and height requirements.
A valid passport and the freedom to travel across borders.
What You‚Äôll Get
A full-time role with remote training and onboarding if you're based in the EMEA region.
Flight benefits, a competitive salary, and attractive allowances.
A chance to travel the world while building a global career.
A truly inclusive, multicultural team that feels like a second family.
Career growth opportunities within one of the most respected names in aviation.
üì© Apply Now
If you‚Äôre excited by the idea of seeing the world, connecting with people from all walks of life, and creating meaningful travel experiences ‚Äî we‚Äôd love to meet you. Let your career take off with us!

title: Design Assistant
detail:
Hybrid Full-time Entry level
Skills: Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, +8 more
description:
About the job
We are looking for two creative Design Assistants to support across key product categories and concepts in the beginning of your career who is interested of working with a global lifestyle brand in a learning environment. As a Design Assistant at J.Lindeberg, you provide focused creative and operational support to the Designers for Men‚Äôs and Women‚Äôs across the brand‚Äôs most strategically important categories such as Outerwear, Jersey, Knits and Accessories. You play a key role in enabling creative excellence by handling essential design tasks and coordination, ensuring processes run smoothly and allowing the Designers to focus on storytelling, innovation, and product leadership. This is a hands-on, detail-oriented role with exposure to the full design lifecycle, ideal for someone organized, curious, and passionate about the intersection of performance and fashion. The role also requires strong coordination skills, cross-functional collaboration, and support in driving PLM accuracy and milestone readiness. Operational reporting on daily activities is made to Senior Designer/Designer, overall reporting line is to the Head of Design.

Areas of Responsibility

Tech Pack Support: Help prepare and update tech packs based on direction from the Senior Designer/Designer.
3D Modeling & File Cleanup: Assist with base modeling, style clean-up, and repetitive tasks in 3D workflows.
Color-Ups & Variations: Apply seasonal colorways and variations to existing designs.
Research: Conduct seasonal trend, fabric, and market research to support design development.
Line Sheet Management: Keep internal line sheets and collection overviews up to date throughout the season.
Sample Tracking: Coordinate and track sample development and deliveries in collaboration with Production and Development teams.
Meeting Recaps & Follow-Ups: Take notes during fittings and design meetings, assist with documentation and next steps.
Design Admin & Coordination: Organize assets, maintain file hygiene, and support communication across teams and tools.
PLM Maintenance: Ensure timely and accurate updates of all product data in the PLM system throughout the design process.
Milestone Support: Help ensure design assets and documentation are prepared and delivered on time for all key calendar meetings and deadlines.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Communicate clearly and reliably with Product Development and Merchandising to ensure alignment across design needs and seasonal timelines.

You should have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in fashion or related field and if you have an interest in Active wear, Golf wear and or RTW you would fit right in. To be successful in this role you need to be proficient in Illustrator and Photoshop and have a thorough understanding in colour. You will be working with colleagues on all levels so you need to appreciate collaboration and have a team oriented approach.

We are despite our size a very entrepreneurial company, so you should enjoy working in a very dynamic and flexible environment and be able to think on your feet.

You will be offered the possibility to work with a global lifestyle brand in a learning environment where you will get the opportunity to grow.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Fashion, Graphic Design or similar/related field
Proficient in Illustrator, Photoshop, PLM, CLO 3D
Strong eye for layout, color, typography, and attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Knowledge of design principles and current trends in digital and print media.
Fluent in English

Founded in Stockholm 1996, J.Lindeberg inspires unconventional thinkers to live life to the fullest. The international fashion house bridges fashion and sport, offering sophisticated, edgy and comfortable products for a modern active lifestyle. The collections bring together creativity and Scandinavian progressiveness ‚Äì for innovative fashion and outdoor lifestyle wear that is sustainable and delivered through a customer-focused, seamless experience.

With headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, the distribution covers more than 35 countries. There are 157 J.Lindeberg stores in several of the major fashion capitals of the world, such as Copenhagen, New York, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Shanghai. The wholesale distribution features close to 2000 stores, including the leading high-end department and specialty stores around the world.

About the job

Maintain and structure efficient workflows for content production and updates.

Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to web content management, including the incorporation of AI technologies.
Work independently while driving local adaptations of global marketing initiatives into compelling local content, which includes localizing content distributed from our HQ.

3+ years of experience in digital content creation and management, with proven ability to write high-quality, engaging content in Nordic languages. (Nordic language skills are a big plus.)
Familiarity with content management systems (CMS), SEO principles, and web analytics tools, alongside a strong consumer-centric approach with strategic and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, demonstrating the ability to link different perspectives and work collaboratively across teams.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Data and fact-driven approach focused on measurable outcomes.
A creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative content ideas and foster a culture of curiosity and willingness to challenge.

title: DevOps Engineer
detail:
Remote Contract Mid-Senior level
Skills: Jenkins Integration Platform, Amazon Web Services Systems (AWS)
description:
About the job
DevOps Engineer (Contract ‚Äì Remote)

Our firm is seeking a DevOps Engineer to support the deployment, reliability, and scalability of our platform as we move from development to launch. This role is fully remote and offered on a contract basis, with a competitive hourly rate for the successful candidate.

Key Responsibilities
Set up and maintain development, staging, and production environments
Build and manage CI/CD pipelines to support fast, reliable deployment
Collaborate with developers to optimise infrastructure and resolve deployment issues
Automate routine tasks and improve developer tooling across the team
Monitor system performance, uptime, and cost efficiency
Implement best practices around security, logging, and backups
Support the incident response process and work to reduce operational risks

Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Experience with containerisation tools (e.g. Docker)
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS preferred; GCP or Azure also considered)
Understanding of CI/CD workflows and tools (e.g. GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins)
Experience working with infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation)
Strong understanding of Linux-based systems and shell scripting
Knowledge of Git for version control
Strong attention to detail and a proactive, problem-solving mindset
Ability to communicate clearly and work effectively in a remote environment

Nice to Have
Familiarity with Kubernetes or other orchestration tools
Exposure to monitoring and alerting tools (e.g. Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog)
Basic understanding of networking and security principles
Prior experience supporting web applications in a startup or early-stage environment

Contract Details
Initial 6-month contract with potential for extension based on project needs and performance
Fully remote working arrangement
Flexible hours and autonomy over your work schedule
Competitive hourly rate

How to Apply
We understand there is no such thing as a perfect fit and we are eager to hear from you if this role interests you. Please submit your CV through LinkedIn Easy Apply. We review applications on a rolling basis and encourage you to apply early.

title: Part Time Sales Assistent
detail:
On-site Part-time Internship
Skills: Retail Sales, Customer Service, +8 more
description:
About the job
Are you passionate about delivering outstanding customer experiences? SHAPING NEW TOMORROW are looking for a Part Time Sales Assistant enthusiastic to join our team in Stockholm. You will play a key role in creating a welcoming atmosphere and ensuring our customers leave with a smile. If you‚Äôre ready to be part of an exciting brand and grow with us, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Are you looking for a student job or something similar and wish to work around 5 hours a week? Then this job might be for you. The hours will be placed both on weekdays and weekends, but we will of course fit them to your education.

As a Part Time Sales Assistant in our store in Stockholm, you will be part of our fresh team where you together will have the opportunity to leave your mark on the daily operations and ensure that the store hits the ground running.

The role of a Part Time Sales Assistant

You will take part in providing our guests with an extraordinary experience in the store, so it is important that you have a passion for sales and great customer service. You will be guided through our unique store concept so that you can ensure great guest experiences - every time.

Your primary tasks will be:

Sales and customer service
Providing our guests with guidance on our products
Ensuring that the store looks sharp - both tidying and stocktaking
Stock replenishment in the store
Take part in store events

The job is a part-time position and your location will be in our store in Stockholm.

There may be opportunities for more hours during certain periods, if that suits you. We offer a high degree of flexibility to support your studies ‚Äì and in return, we appreciate your flexibility during busy times when the team needs an extra hand.

Who are you?

We have had great experiences with our part-time employees and we see them as being crucial players in our team. As a Part Time Sales Assistant, you will be an important ambassador for SHAPING NEW TOMORROW.

We imagine that you:

Are easy to be around and understand how to build great relationships with guests and colleagues
Are flexible and always ready to help 
Can work independently and that you are service-minded
Have a natural sense of style
Are outgoing and energetic
Keep the good vibes in the store and the team

It is an advantage if you have previous experience in fashion and retail but not a must. Besides your daily tasks, we expect that you can give a hand in busy periods when we are running fast and need all hands on deck.

Who are we?

SHAPING NEW TOMORROW has gone from being an ambitious start-up with 10 employees to a fast-growing scale-up company with more than 230 dedicated Shapers. You‚Äôll become a part of a passionate team, where we chase new dreams and challenge the status quo every day. We have a strong community and a unique employee culture where there‚Äôs room to spread your wings and focus on personal development. We‚Äôre full of ideas, solution-oriented, and focused on running a healthy business.

We believe in people and love talents. Our goal is to give our Shapers a healthy and fun work environment that allows them to be themselves and stretch further.

Are you ready to become a Shaper?

Do you want to be part of our exciting journey? Then do not hesitate to send us your application and CV, as we cannot wait to get our new colleagues on board! Therefore, we will continuously interview relevant candidates until we find the perfect match. So, send us your application as soon as possible.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us through our Career Page or feel free to visit our store in Stockholm.

In 2015, the story of SHAPING NEW TOMORROW began in the city of Aalborg, Denmark. Three childhood friends set out to change the way we think of traditional menswear, by seamlessly blending the comfort of sportswear with the style of casual business attire. From these beginnings, SHAPING NEW TOMORROW has since grown and evolved into an innovative, tech-oriented, and international clothing brand.

title: Geologists to Exploration department
detail:
On-site Full-time Entry level
Skills: Geology, Drilling, +8 more
description:
About the job
Job Posting End Date / last application date:

2025-08-31

Step into a role where your curiosity meets purpose. Join our exploration team in Kiruna and contribute to securing LKAB‚Äôs future in a workplace that values collaboration, innovation and long-term sustainability. 

Shaping the future

At LKAB, we are leading the transformation of our industry toward a sustainable future. Just as we aim to reshape the world, we are committed to developing every individual on our team, both personally and professionally.

Are you ready to help shape the future of the mining and mineral industry?

Your role 

We are now looking for a geologist to our near mine exploration group in Kiruna. The Exploration department exists to identify and investigate mineral deposits and secure LKAB's future. Mineral reserves and mineral assets are LKAB's most important resource, therefore our work is a prerequisite for a sustainable and long-term competitive LKAB.

As part of our team, you work in close collaboration with other geologists and technicians in an interesting workplace with challenging duties and good opportunities for further development.

For this role the main tasks to start with will be collection and interpretation of geological data from drill core and supervision of ongoing drill programs, with room to gradually be introduced to other responsibilities.

The near mine exploration department are amongst other things responsible for:

Planning and supervision of diamond drilling in and around the mine areas 
Drill core logging & sampling 
Interpretation of geological data 
3D Modelling in Leapfrog 
QAQC & validation of drill hole data 


What You Bring

We are looking for a geologist with some practical experience in exploration, mining or project development. We see that you have at least a B.Sc. degree in geology. Knowledge of common software‚Äôs such as acQuire & Leapfrog is beneficial but not a requirement.

As a person you should be responsible and driven, but also percipient and flexible. The position includes a lot of collaboration with others both within and outside the company, so good collaboration skills are essential.

A Driving license is a requirement for the position. You speak and write English fluently. It¬¥s a plus if you speak and write Swedish, but if not, we want you to be eager to learn.

What We Offer

Reward program
Free access to LKAB‚Äôs own gym and our partners‚Äô facilities in Norrbotten
Wellness allowance and educational support, along with access to an art association, leisure club, mountain cabins, and family activities
Enhanced parental pay with up to 90% of your regular salary for up to six months (after one year of employment)
Support and assistance in cases of illness or questions about work environment, health, wellness, and rehabilitation
Compensation for dental care and protective eyewear, including terminal glasses
Opportunity to apply for scholarships for both your and your children‚Äôs studies
Access to our pension and insurance program with favorable rates
Relocation support for you and your family. 
Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.


Additional Information

You will be based in the town of Kiruna close to the mining operations, situated in Swedish Lapland above the Arctic Circle. The area offers great opportunities for fantastic outdoor activities, such as hunting, fishing, hiking, skiing, ice climbing, etc. http://www.kirunalapland.se/en/.

Start: According to agreement

Employment type: Permanent

Due the holiday period there might be a delay in responses. Submit your application no later than 31st of August 2025. Selection takes place continuously. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

For more information about the position please contact: Joel Krispinsson, Group Manager Kiruna, joel.krispinsson@lkab.com

Union representatives:

Unionen, Sakari Alanko, 0980-725 08

Akademikerf√∂reningen, Peter Johansson, 0980-718 79

Ledarna, Ingegerd Kyr√∂, 0980-710 50

About LKAB

LKAB is an international mining and minerals group with northern Sweden as its base and the whole world as its workplace. We lead the way towards carbon-free production and we do it together - in an open, warm and safe work environment with technology and development in focus. We welcome challenges, innovative ideas and initiative, always with equality and diversity in focus.

Do you work at LKAB today but are interested in a new role?

Then we would like you to submit your application via our internal career page. Log in to your Workday account and go to "Jobs Hub", where you can search for all available jobs and send your application.

Prior to recruitment, LKAB has considered recruitment channels and marketing. We kindly but firmly decline all contact from media marketers, recruitment sites and the like.

title: HSEQ Coordinator
detail:
Remote Full-time Associate
Skills: Health, Safety, Environmental and Quality Management Systems, Action Plans, +4 more
description:
About the job
We have an exciting opportunity to join our Nordics and Baltics team. The WPO Group is a privately owned provider of expert services including technical and commercial asset management services to our renewable energy clients. WPO currently operates across 14 European countries through 48 offices or service points, windfarms and solar sites.

The Role
We are seeking a proactive Operational HSEQ Coordinator, based in Dalarnas l√§n (Sweden), to support our on-site team across the Nordics & Baltics (initially Lithuania). You will be a key player in monitoring and improving HSEQ practices in the field, ensuring compliance with the industry best practices and EU standards & regulations. The role involves frequent travel to operational sites and working closely with WPO operational team to drive a strong safety culture.

Key Responsibilities
Monitor the WPO‚Äôs HSEQ management system in the Nordics & Baltics
Source training, according to the Group Training Matrix, as and when required ensuring compliance to European standards where applicable. 
Maintain PPE register ensuring compliance with deadlines (statutory inspection), competitive pricing and ‚Äòfit for purpose‚Äô requirements.
Conduct regular HSEQ audits and inspections across windfarms in the Nordics & Baltics.
Coordinate the compilation of HSEQ audits‚Äô findings in our tracker tool
Participate in HSEQ events reporting, investigations, root cause analyses, and corrective action planning.
Review and update risk assessments.
Carry out on a regular basis regulatory compliance for the Nordics & Baltics (Sweden, Finland, Lithuania).
Support emergency response drills with operational and rescue teams.
Assist operational team with HSEQ queries.
Organise and document regular HSEQ meetings with contractors (O&Ms‚Ä¶).

Your Profile
Minimum 2 years‚Äô experience in a similar HSEQ role or operational role, ideally in the renewables sector.
Good IT skills, particularly MS Word & Excel and Office 365 Tools.
Demonstrable organisational skills are essential.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal format to clients, staff and third parties alike.
Capable of working under your own initiatives and to targets.
Ability to work independently and travel regularly to remote sites.
Practical, hands-on approach with strong interpersonal skills.
Valid driving license (B-class) required.
Experience conducting site audits would bring a distinct advantage.

What We Offer
A hybrid role combining home office and field-based activities.
Competitive salary and benefits including a very good company pension in Sweden (10%).
25 days‚Äô paid vacation annually, plus Swedish public holidays.
Professional growth in a purpose-driven, European renewable energy company.

title: Landscape architect
detail:
Hybrid Full-time
Skills: Landscape, Landscape Architecture, +8 more
description:
About the job
Do you want to be part of shaping the sustainable green society of the future? Do you have a great interest in urban development and landscape architecture? We work in exciting assignments and are looking for an independent landscape architect to join our group in Sweden. Are you our next employee?

Join us in Shaping Sustainable Landscapes

Our work and expertise in landscape architecture includes everything from feasibility studies and design programs to detailed design of residential buildings and complex infrastructure projects.

In our work for sustainable development with a focus on people, it is a central and obvious part to incorporate value-creating ecosystem services. We are committed to the reuse of materials, the use of sustainable materials and technologies, and multifunctional green-blue solutions.

Through a good spread in the group in terms of experience, skills and age, you will have the opportunity to further develop your skills through exciting assignments, a good atmosphere at work and a varied and challenging everyday work life. The projects are planned and implemented with a multidisciplinary perspective in close collaboration between our various experts in traffic planning, stormwater management, water and sewerage/land/roads, geotechnics, construction, environment, climate and sustainability. The assignments vary from early stages and investigations to design.

Your skills. Our Team. Together we shape the future

Your skills are the key to our success. We work across borders and in different areas of business, sharing our knowledge and building strong relationships with customers and colleagues. You'll bring your expertise to the table while also having the opportunity to learn from the best.

To succeed in this role, you are passionate about landscape architecture, enjoy communicating with others to achieve goals, and have an interest in supporting colleagues with your knowledge.

We are looking for you who;

- Are a landscape architect with a degree in landscape architecture and who have worked for 5 years or more as a landscape architect. 

- Have experience of working in infrastructure projects and/or with public clients.

- Have been working as a Discipline leader in projects.

- Are fluent in Swedish both spoken and written

You must be creative and committed, and we want you to have experience of investigations, landscape analyses, design programmes and detailed design. You have good design skills, an interest in sustainability issues and master working with landscape architecture and urban development on both a smaller and larger scale.

As a person, you are a responsive team player, flexible, solution-oriented and driven. As we work a lot in teams and help each other, it is important that you are unpretentious and enjoy working both independently and in groups.

We want you to have extensive experience of working in Civil 3D and the Adobe suite, but also that you master Microsoft office and administration tools.

In the event of an interview, we will ask you to show work samples from both the early stages and the detailed design.

A place to work and so much more
At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America and India, we are currently 7,300 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy and environment into play.

Got more questions?
If you would like to learn more about the role, do not hesitate to reach out to: Gabriella Vestin, acting Head of Discipline Landscape and Urban planning, gave@cowi.com.

If you want to apply, apply via the link, we are eager to hear from you! Apply directly as the role may be filled before the ad's closing date.
Get to know us even better at our website, www.cowi.com, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.

Equal Opportunities for All
At COWI, we value equal opportunities for all employees and applicants based on individual circumstances without regard to gender, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or age.
